body:
> As I pointed out further above - this is impossible to implement.

Impossible to do completely, possible to do intentionally if you parsed the source, knew it looked a certain way, and altered it to use Ruby's [autoload](http://www.ruby-doc.org/core-2.0/Kernel.html#method-i-autoload) (I thought they were getting rid of that?), even without touching Rails dependency management. :)

But, yeah, I shouldn't have mentioned it. That was more a postulation of what would be a reason to consider doing this, and it won't happen, so that's "[right out](http://pythonline.com/node/239175)".

Now, you can definitely unload constants or change what comes back from const_missing. Months ago I [messed around](https://github.com/garysweaver/constance) trying to help someone get around a conflict with Journey being the same name as a model. I never really was able to come up with a feasible solution to that despite the example in the readme, but it was fun trying.

Anyway- I'm totally in favor of ditching this idea. Sorry again.
